block-definition.comment: draw a list of numbers as vertical lines distributed evenly across the stage.

Draw a picture of the specified model of a neural network where each layer is represented as a vertical line of dots and each weight as a line between 2 neuron-dots. The line width represents the weight's absolute value, negative values can be rendered in another color.
block-definition.translations: de:male neurales Modell _ _ ca:renderitza el model neuronal _ _

block-definition.comment: Report a copy of the given table in which the numerical data of each column is distributed between 0 and 1 using the column's min and max values (feature scaling).

Report a function (ring) that can be called with a single row (record) in the form of the given data set to normalize it using the sample's min and max values. Use this reporter to create a normalization function from a training set that can be applied to validation or live data.
block-definition.translations: de:Normalisierung für Tabelle _ ca:normalització per a la taula _

block-definition.comment: Split a table into 2 sets by randomly assigning its rows to each partition at the given ratio while making sure that every category (as indicated by the tag in the last column) is represented equally in both sets, reports a 2-item list containing the shuffled and split data. Use this block to create training and validation data sets.
block-definition.translations: de:teile Tabelle _ im Verhältnis _ ca:partició de _ per _

block-definition.comment: Generate a new block in the sensing category that either reports the class of a given sample data record (for the the "classifier" option) or whether a given sample data record classifies as the given tag (name) based on an example dataset (for the "predicate" option) in the form of a binary truth table. The generated predicate block offers its estimated accuracy in its help screen / comment and can then be exported and shared. By default training happens all automatically using a neural network with one hidden layer, observing the learning progress and partitioning the dataset internally into a training set and validation set. Optionally you can specify an exact number of epochs (0 = automatic), a partitioning fraction (0 = automatic, 1 = none), and none to 8 hidden layers with arbitrary neurons (0 = no hidden layers). You can abort / shorten the training process manually by positioning the mouse pointer near the stage center and pressing the mouse button down. Running the command again updates any previously generated block, i.e. you can optimize existing blocks by re-training them with different parameters.
Create and report a new neural network with the specified topology representing the number of inputs, arbitrary hidden layers, and output(s).
block-definition.translations: de:neues neuronales Netzwerk _ ca:nova xarxa neuronal _

list.l: predict whether the data sample classifies as

block-definition.comment: Train a single epoch or validate a neural model on a truth-table dataset (a list of number-vectors with the expected classification in the last column). For "train" this reports the accumulated activation error over the epoch. For "validate" this reports the overall classification accuracy of the dataset. For "confusion matrix" this reports an aggregated binary error table in the form: TP, FP FN, TN
block-definition.translations: de:_ Netzwerk _ mit _ ca:_ xarxa _ amb _

block-definition.comment: Predict and report the classification of a given data sample - a list of numbers representing a single record in a dataset - using the specified neural network instance. The result is a list of numbers representing the neural network's output layer. The "classify" selector reports the absolute classification, "predict" reports the unrounded output of the forward pass, letting you determine the neural network's confidence.
block-definition.translations: de:_ _ mit Netzwerk _ ca:_ _ amb la xarxa _

block-definition.comment: Query the model or the learning rate of a given neural network. For "model" this reports a list of weight-matrices representing the neural network's hidden and output layers. Models can be exported and shared among projects. For "learning rate" this reports a single number representing the neural network's eagerness to adjust its weights when learning.
block-definition.translations: de:_ von Netzwerk _ ca:_ de la xarxa _

inputs.input: $_get modelget model=$_get model get learning rate=$_get learning rate get topology=$_get topology

block-definition.comment: Assign a pre-trained model to the given neural network or change its learning rate.
block-definition.translations: de:_ von Netzwerk _ auf _ ca:_ de la xarxa _ a _

inputs.input: $_set modelset model=$_set model set learning rate=$_set learning rate

block-definition.comment: Create and report a new sprite that can serve as a layer in a neural network of sprites. It responds to 3 events / methods: 1) setup Initializes the layer with a list of 2 numbers representing the number of inputs and the number of desired output neurons. 2) predict Reports the result of a forward pass of a single sample / record with the precision of the activation function, i.e. not rounded for classification. If you wish to use this answer to classify the record you must also sum and round the list of results. 3) learn Adjusts the layer's weights depending on the given delta vector and reports a new delta vector to be backpropagated to the previous layer, if any. You can either use a single sprite as a SLP (perceptron), or clone it several time to create additional hidden layers for a deep neural network by using a forward PIPE for prediction and a backward PIPE for learning.
report the most frequent result of repeatedly evaluating a function a given number of times
